intro: Haplopappus scrobiculatus, commonly known as the roughleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, with a grayish-green color, and the flowers are small and yellowish. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
